required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Protein Supplements in Association With Prehabilitation Program for Cancer Patients Before Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Suppléments protéinés en Association d'un Programme de préhabilitation Avant la Prise en Charge Chirurgicale d'un Cancer

lead_sponsor.agency: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain

clinical_study.source: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of study is to analyse the feasibility of the use of nutritionnal complements after exercices before surgery for cancer.
Body composition, muscle function and muscle mass will be analyse too.

detailed_description.textblock:
A prospective study will be carried out including adult patients with neoplasia who should benefit in their therapeutic strategy from oncological surgery. About fifty patients will be recruited in the oncology / surgery department at the Saint-Luc University Clinics in Brussels. Patients will be assessed at the initial consultation and after the pre-habilitation period, ie the day before the operation.
Dietary monitoring will be carried out in parallel with a physical and respiratory preparation program (prehabilitation) and the intake of protein nutritional supplements in the form of powder to be diluted will be carried out after each exercise session.

primary_outcome.measure: Adhesion rate of the use of nutritionnel complements after exercices before surgery for cancer
primary_outcome.description: The feasibility of this outcome will be assess by the adhesion rate : (number of protein shots taken) / (number of protein shots prescribed). The adhesion will be validated if> 75% of the holds are respected.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Once at the inclusion and once the day before surgery (3 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluated by an impedancemetry balance : pourcentage of lean and fat mass

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Once at the inclusion and once the day before surgery (3 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: This variable will be studied by the 6-minutes walk test (meters)
These variables will be studied by: prealbumin (g/L) and albumin (g/L) measures

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Once at the inclusion and once the day before surgery (3 weeks)
Once at the inclusion and once the day before surgery (3 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: This variable will be studied by the hand grip test (kilograms)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Once at the inclusion and once the day before surgery (3 weeks)
Once at the inclusion and once the day before surgery (3 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: BMI (kg/m²) :weight and height will be combined to report BMI in kg/m²

arm_group.description: A prospective study will be carried out including adult patients with neoplasia who should benefit in their therapeutic strategy from oncological surgery. About fifty patients will be recruited in the oncology / surgery department at the Saint-Luc University Clinics in Brussels. Patients will be assessed at the initial consultation and after the pre-habilitation period, ie the day before the operation. Dietary monitoring will be carried out in parallel with a physical and respiratory preparation program (prehabilitation) and the intake of protein nutritional supplements in the form of powder to be diluted will be carried out after each exercise session.

intervention.description: Patient receive protein supplement in liquid form after each exercice session

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patient with operable cancer
- patient inform consent
- min 18 years old
- french or english speaking
Exclusion Criteria:
- neuromuscular pathology
- cardiorespiratory or orthopedic pathology that prevents physical activity
- cognitive or psychiatric disorders

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain
